003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.
004 * Permission to use and distribute this software is granted under the BSD 2-Clause

007 * All rights reserved. Visit https://imagingbook.com for additional details.
008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.geometry.circle;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static java.lang.Math.abs;
013import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
014
015import java.awt.Shape;
016import java.awt.geom.Arc2D;
017import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
018import java.util.Locale;
019
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Primitive2d;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.shape.ShapeProducer;
023import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
024
025/**
026 * <p>
027 * Represents a geometric circle with center point (xc, yc) and radius r.
028 * Instances are immutable. See Sec. 11.1.1 and Appendix F.2.1 of [1] for details.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
032 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
033 * </p>
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2022/11/17
037 */
038public class GeometricCircle implements ShapeProducer, Primitive2d {
039        
040        /**
041         * Circle parameter.
042         */
043        public final double xc, yc, r;
044
045        /**
046         * Constructor.
047         * @param xc center x-coordinate
048         * @param yc center y-coordinate
049         * @param r circle radius
050         */
051        public GeometricCircle(double xc, double yc, double r) {
052                if (r < 0) {
053                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("negative circle radius");
054                }
055                this.xc = xc;
056                this.yc = yc;
057                this.r = r;             
058        }
059        
060        /**
061         * Constructor.
062         * Creates a new {@link GeometricCircle} instance from parameters p = [xc, yc, r].
063         * @param p circle parameters [xc, yc, r]
064         */
065        public GeometricCircle(double[] p) {
066                this(p[0], p[1], p[2]);
067        }
068        
069        /**
070         * Constructor.
071         * Creates a new {@link GeometricCircle} from a {@link AlgebraicCircle} instance.
072         * @param ac a {@link AlgebraicCircle} instance
073         */
074        public GeometricCircle(AlgebraicCircle ac) {
075                this(getGeometricCircleParameters(ac));
076        }
077        
078        private static double[] getGeometricCircleParameters(AlgebraicCircle ac) {
079                double[] p = ac.getParameters();
080                if (Arithmetic.isZero(p[0])) {
081                        throw new RuntimeException("infinite circle radius");
082                }
083                double A = p[0];
084                double B = p[1];
085                double C = p[2];
086                double D = p[3];
087                double xc = -B / (2 * A);
088                double yc = -C / (2 * A);
089                double r = sqrt(sqr(B) + sqr(C) - 4 * A * D) / abs(2 * A);
090                return new double[] {xc, yc, r};
091        }
092        
093        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
094        
095        /**
096         * Returns a vector of geometric circle parameters (xc, yc, r).
097         * 
098         * @return geometric circle parameters (xc, yc, r)
099         */
100        public double[] getParameters() {
101                return new double[] {xc, yc, r};
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * Returns the center point of this circle.
106         * @return the center point
107         */
108        public Pnt2d getCenter() {
109                return Pnt2d.from(xc, yc);
110        }
111
112        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
113        
114        /**
115         * Calculates and returns the mean of the squared distances between this circle 
116         * and a set of 2D points.
117         *
118         * @param points a set of sample points (usually the points used for fitting)
119         * @return the mean squared error
120         */
121        public double getMeanSquareError(Pnt2d[] points) {
122                final int n = points.length;
123                double sumR2 = 0;
124                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
125                        sumR2 += sqr(getDistance(points[i]));
126                }
127                return sumR2 / n;
128        }
129        
130        /**
131         * Returns the (unsigned) distance between the specified point
132         * and this circle. The result is always non-negative.
133         * 
134         * @param p a 2D point
135         * @return the point's distance from the circle
136         */
137        @Override
138        public double getDistance(Pnt2d p) {
139                return Math.abs(getSignedDistance(p));
140        }
141        
142        /**
143         * Returns the signed distance between the specified point
144         * and this circle. The result is positive for points outside
145         * the circle, negative inside.
146         * 
147         * @param p a 2D point
148         * @return the point's signed distance from the circle
149         */
150        public double getSignedDistance(Pnt2d p) {
151                double dx = p.getX() - this.xc;
152                double dy = p.getY() - this.yc;
153                double rp = Math.hypot(dx, dy);
154                return rp - this.r;
155        }
156        
157        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
158
159        private Shape getCenterShape(double radius) {
160                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
161                path.moveTo(xc - radius, yc);
162                path.lineTo(xc + radius, yc);
163                path.moveTo(xc, yc - radius);
164                path.lineTo(xc, yc + radius);
165                return path;
166        }
167        
168        private Shape getOuterShape() {
169                return new Arc2D.Double(xc - r, yc - r, 2 * r, 2 * r, 0, 360, Arc2D.OPEN);
170        }
171        
172        @Override
173        public Shape getShape(double scale) {
174                return getOuterShape() ;
175        }
176        
177        @Override
178        public Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
179                return new Shape[] {getOuterShape(), getCenterShape(scale)};
180        }
181        
182        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
183        
184        @Override
185        public boolean equals(Object other) {
186                if (this == other) {
187                        return true;
188                }
189                if (!(other instanceof GeometricCircle)) {
190            return false;
191        }
192                return this.equals((GeometricCircle) other, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
193        }
194        
195        
196        public boolean equals(GeometricCircle other, double tolerance) {
197                return 
198                                Arithmetic.equals(xc, other.xc, tolerance) &&
199                                Arithmetic.equals(yc, other.yc, tolerance) &&
200                                Arithmetic.equals(r, other.r, tolerance) ;
201        }
202        
203        public boolean equals(GeometricCircle other, double tolXc, double tolYc, double tolR) {
204                return 
205                                Arithmetic.equals(xc, other.xc, tolXc) &&
206                                Arithmetic.equals(yc, other.yc, tolYc) &&
207                                Arithmetic.equals(r, other.r, tolR) ;
208        }
209        
210        /**
211         * Returns a copy of this circle.
212         * @return a copy of this circle
213         */
214        public GeometricCircle duplicate() {
215                return new GeometricCircle(this.getParameters());
216        }
217        
218        @Override
219        public String toString() {
220                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s [xc=%f, yc=%f, r=%f]", 
221                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), xc, yc, r);
222        }
223}
